data.title: Transportation
data.text:
Midway between Boston and New York City.

Madison, is conveniently located on the Connecticut shoreline midway between Boston and New York City. Due to our strategic geographic location, access to interstates, deep water seaports, rail and international air travel is a easily accessible. Just 20 miles north of New Haven, many major cities are within a 2 hour drive.

Railroad

Shore Line East Train Station

77 Bradley Road

Madison, CT 06443

*Shore Line East (SLE) trains run seven days a week including holidays, making stops at New London, Old Saybrook, Westbrook, Clinton, Madison, Guilford, Branford, and New Haven at State Street and Union Station, with limited express service to/from West Haven, Bridgeport and Stamford. Connecting service is available at Union Station, New Haven for Amtrak and Metro-North.
